comingle.comms.directory

Class BaseDirectory<D extends java.io.Serializable>

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Thread
      • comingle.comms.datapipe.DataPipeManager<D,A>
        • comingle.comms.listeners.ListeningPost<D,java.lang.String>
          • comingle.comms.directory.BaseDirectory<D>
  • Type Parameters:
    D - the class of the administrative messages sent between directory instances. Must be serializable.
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    Logger, Neighborhood, java.lang.Runnable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    LanDirectory

    public abstract class BaseDirectory<D extends java.io.Serializable>
extends ListeningPost<D,java.lang.String>
    Basic Directory class. Maintains a routing table that contain mappings from unique location identifiers to IP addresses and other relevant device information (Name, address, ID, etc..). Each participating instance of this directory communicates with one instance, acting as the owner of the group. Events that changes the directory (new member connected, a member leaving, etc..) are broadcasted by the owner. Applications running this directory can subscribe to such events through the various listener types found in comingle.comms.listener . This listener functionalities are inherited from the ListeningPost class.
    Author:
    Edmund S.L. Lam

    • Constructor Detail

      • BaseDirectory

        public BaseDirectory(DataPipe<D,java.lang.String> pipe,
             java.lang.String reqCode,
             int networkID,
             java.lang.String localDisplayName,
             java.lang.String localDeviceID,
             boolean useDeviceIDAsLocationID)
        Basic Constructor of the directory
        Parameters:
        pipe - the data pipe that exchanges administrative data, to be embedded in this base directory.
        reqCode - the request code that is required to join this directory.
        networkID - the unique identifier of the network used by this directory.
        localDisplayName - the local display name of the directory.
        localDeviceID - the local device ID, used to uniquely identify the application which this directory is part of.
        useDeviceIDAsLocationID - true if device ID should be used as location ID. Otherwise, owner location will be assign '0' with members uniquely assigned increments of 1.

      • establishRole

        public boolean establishRole()
        Try to establish the role of this directory. In order to do so, the following criteria must be fullfilled: i. Role not established earlier. ii. Display name is not null. iii. Request Code is not null. iv. Directory has determined that it is either an owner or member.
        Returns:
        true if role has been successfully established.

      • init

        public void init()
        Runs the 'start' method of this Thread class. See 'run' for the actual operations invoked.

      • stopRoutines

        public void stopRoutines()
        Signals the directory to stop all active subroutines. This includes, member connection attempts and owner ping routines. Administrative data pipe will not be affected.

      • close

        public void close()
        Close all operations of the directory. Specifically, an owner will notify all members of this closure, while a member will notify the owner. This is followed by the termination of all active threads of this directory, namely administrative data pipes and connection loops.
        Overrides:
        close in class DataPipeManager<D extends java.io.Serializable,java.lang.String>

      • doWifiAdapterStatusChanged

        public void doWifiAdapterStatusChanged(boolean enabled)
        Invoke network status changed listeners. The doWifiAdapterStatusChangedAction of each listener will be called. This method is intended to be called by a network monitoring service (e.g., a BroadcastReceiver that registers on network events.).
        Overrides:
        doWifiAdapterStatusChanged in class ListeningPost<D extends java.io.Serializable,java.lang.String>
        Parameters:

        Overrides:
        doWifiConnectionStatusChanged in class ListeningPost<D extends java.io.Serializable,java.lang.String>
        Parameters:
        connected - true if the wifi adapter is connected to some network.
